what: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
title: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
text: {ggtricks} package collection multiple geom presenting data form circle (now, many come just circle oriented.) using grammar graphics philosophy Cartesian coordinates system. lot functions make sector charts circle split along circumference, therefore section proportional value represents. geom_pie Pie charts geom_donut Donut charts (Pie chart hole) geom_slice Part Pie charts geom_donut_slice Part Donut charts also function, geom_series_circles() plot call series circles, draws category many circles fraction circles needed represent value represented category. companion function geom_series_text defined put labels boundary series circles calculating boundary positions can tedious depending starting angle fragments circles.

title: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
text: can install stable version ggtricks like : developpement version:
code: install.packages("ggtricks") devtools::install_github("abdoulma/ggtricks")

title: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
text: Basic Example  course, fill mapping argument drive category filling color.  course, can choose, customize categories labels setting axis.text theme_*() function. need may come add labels series circles boundary positions. comes geom_series_text() function.  can set init_angle define fragment circle starting angle. Series circles Init angles Two series circles combination Let’s illustrate use combination two series circles another example Charts Graphs (introduction graphics methods control analysis statistics) KARL G. KARSTEN, B.. Series circles combination
code:
library(tidyverse) library(ggtricks)  my_theme <- function(...) {   theme_minimal() +     theme(       text = element_text(family = "Atkinson Hyperlegible"),       axis.text.y = element_text(color = "black", size = rel(1.5))     ) } prod_df <- data.frame(   good = c("Potatoes", "Sugar", "Butter", "Coffee", "Rice", "Eggs", "Flour", "Tea", "Milk"),   index = c(606, 485, 204, 165, 215, 268, 267, 137, 194) )  prod_df <- prod_df |>   mutate(     index = index / 100,     good = fct_rev(fct_inorder(good))   )  prod_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_series_circles(aes(index, good), color = "white") +   coord_equal() +   my_theme() prod_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_series_circles(aes(index, good, fill = good), color = "black", linewidth = 2.5) +   coord_equal() +   my_theme() prod_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_series_circles(aes(index, good, fill = good), color = "black", linewidth = 2.5) +   geom_series_text(aes(index, good, label = index), size = 6, family = "Atkinson Hyperlegible") +   coord_equal(clip = "off") +   guides(     fill = "none",   ) +   my_theme() index_df <- tribble(   ~article, ~index,   "Plate beef", 187,   "Bacon", 215,   "Lard", 266 )  index_df <- index_df |>   mutate(     index = index / 100   )  index_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_series_circles(aes(index, article),     init_angle = 45     # init_angle = 90     # init_angle = 145     # init_angle = 180   ) +   coord_equal() +   theme_minimal() usa_trades <- tribble(   ~country, ~with_foreign, ~with_us,   "United States", 13359, 13359,   "United Kingdom", 15925, 3123,   "Canada", 2304, 1256,   "France", 7429, 1686,   "Italy", 4189, 1516,   "Netherlands", 2639, 316,   "Japan", 2421, 1420,   "Germany", 4966, 577 )  usa_trades <- usa_trades |>   mutate(     country = fct_rev(fct_inorder(country)),     across(.cols = contains("with"), \(x) x / 1e3, .names = "{.col}")   ) |>   arrange(country) |>   mutate(     row_num = row_number()   )  n_rows <- nrow(usa_trades) usa_trades |>   ggplot() +   geom_series_circles(aes(with_foreign, country), fill = "white", color = "black", linewidth = 2) +   geom_series_circles(aes(with_us, country)) +   geom_text(aes(y = row_num, label = scales::comma(with_us)), x = -1, family = "Atkinson Hyperlegible", hjust = 1) +   geom_text(aes(y = row_num, label = scales::comma(with_foreign)), x = -2, family = "Atkinson Hyperlegible", hjust = 1) +   geom_text(aes(y = row_num, label = country), x = -3.5, family = "Atkinson Hyperlegible", fontface = "bold", hjust = 1) +   annotate(geom = "text", x = -1, y = n_rows + 1, label = "Trade
 with
 U.S.", family = "Atkinson Hyperlegible", hjust = 1) +   annotate(geom = "text", x = -2, y = n_rows + 1, label = "Total
 Foreign
 Trade", family = "Atkinson Hyperlegible", hjust = 1) +   annotate(geom = "text", x = 8, y = n_rows + 1, label = "(Millions of Dollars)", family = "Atkinson Hyperlegible") +   scale_x_continuous(     limits = c(-5, 14)   ) +   coord_equal(clip = "off") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     axis.text = element_blank(),     axis.title = element_blank(),     panel.grid = element_blank(),      plot.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = NA)   )

title: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
text: init_angle geom_series_circles(), can set init angle parameter set starting angle pie (pie, also available donut, slice donut_slice.)  spotlight_max & spotlight_position want category max value determine slices positions, can set spotlight_max parameter true. category max value placed spotlight_position (default top, others possible values : right, bottom left.) Spotlight max positions spotlight_cat Maybe, want specific category drive slices positions rather category maximum value ? comes spotlight_cat parameter define driving category. Also can combine spotlight_cat parameter value spotlight_position specify position.  labels know can difficult know coordinates center positions category slices, define default label mapping place provided labels position. label mapping defined, can define labels_with_tick parameter TRUE add tick mark centers positions slices. Labels () ticks
code: my_df <- data.frame(   cat = paste0("Prod ", 1:4),   val = c(87, 34, 21, 8) )  categories_fills <- c(   "Prod 1" = "#3E71EC",   "Prod 2" = "#A9A9A9",   "Prod 3" = "#7942A6",   "Prod 4" = "#F7324B" ) my_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_pie(aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat),     init_angle = 0     # init_angle = 60,     # init_angle = 120,     # init_angle = 180   ) +   coord_equal() +   scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills   ) +   theme_minimal() my_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_pie(aes(cat = cat, val = val),     spotlight_max = TRUE,     spotlight_position = "top",     # spotlight_position = "right"     # spotlight_position = "bottom"     # spotlight_position = "left"   ) +   coord_equal() +   scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills   ) +   theme_minimal() my_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_pie(aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat),     spotlight_cat = "Prod 1",     spotlight_position = "top"   ) +   coord_equal() +   scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills,     guide = "none"   ) +   theme_minimal() my_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_pie(     aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat, label = cat)     # labels_with_ticks = TRUE   ) +   coord_equal() +   scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills,     guide = "none"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
text: Donut just pie hole . two parameters r1 r2 define thickness donut.  others parameters available geom_pie available also .
code: my_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_donut(aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat),     r1 = 1, r2 = .65     # r1 =  1 , r2 = .35   ) +   coord_equal() +   scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills,     guide = "none"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
text: portion pie, default half (180 deg). can set slice_angle portion needed. Slices plots different angles Also , can set starting angle position init_angle. Note spotlight_max, spotlight_cat parameters, since drawing complete circle (theoretically can, set slice_angle 360, means pie.) Slice plots different init angles can however set slice position slice_position(possible values : top, right, bottom, left). Soon, post detailed examples package website: https://abdoulma.github.io/ggtricks/.
code: my_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_slice(aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat),     slice_angle = 180 # ,     # slice_angle = 120   ) +   coord_equal() +   scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills,     guide = "none"   ) +   theme_minimal() my_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_slice(aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat),     init_angle = 30 # ,     # init_angle = 90   ) +   coord_equal() +   scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills,     guide = "none"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
text: slice donut plot. geom_donut, driven 2 radii slice plot, defined slice angle. Donut slice plots different angles geom_slice_donut also special parameter link_with_origin, want connect donut slice boundaries origin.
code: my_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_donut_slice(aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat),     r1 = 1, r2 = .65     # r1 = 1, r2  = .35,     # slice_angle = 90     # slice_angle = 120     # slice_angle = 180   ) +   coord_equal() +   scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills,     guide = "none"   ) +   theme_minimal() my_df |>   ggplot() +   geom_donut_slice(aes(cat = cat, val = val, fill = cat),     r1 = 1, r2 = .65,     slice_angle = 120,     slice_position = "top",     link_with_origin = TRUE   ) +   coord_equal(clip = "off") +   scale_fill_manual(     values = categories_fills,     guide = "none"   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
text: might noticed, generate circle, use coord_equal(), using coord_cartesian() zoom plot, generating appealing circle shape even underlying drawn plot circle. , fix, aspect ratio force : physical representation data units axes. according official documentation. course, shouldn’t edit default ratio = 1 ensures one unit x-axis length one unit y-axis. using geom_series_circles(), desire come one day combine facet_wrap() facet_grid() faceting function, , way envision. Since using coord_equal(), won’t able set scales parameter, strongly suspect try . moment, advise . However, provide tips go restrictions package website https://abdoulma.github.io/ggtricks/

title: Create Sector and Other Charts Easily Using Grammar of Graphics
text: coming weeks, additional features added current geoms: Detach spotlighted category Variate radii representation categories Label displaying mapping (choose categories want display) Special key draw pie slice another one donut donut_slice. announced start, limiting package sector charts, additional geom styles added, suppositions, fee free open issue, open contributions.

what: Create donut plot using Cartesian coordinates system — geom_donut
title: Create donut plot using Cartesian coordinates system — geom_donut
text: two arguments absolutely needed  aes() mappings: cat discrete categories vector. val numerical values vector.

title: Create donut plot using Cartesian coordinates system — geom_donut
code: geom_donut(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   show.legend = NA,   na.rm = FALSE,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   init_angle = 0,   x0 = 0,   y0 = 0,   r1 = 1,   r2 = 0.65,   color = "black",   alpha = 1,   linewidth = 0.5,   spotlight_max = FALSE,   spotlight_cat = NULL,   spotlight_position = NULL,   labels_with_tick = FALSE,   labels_family = "",   labels_size = 5,   labels_col = "black",   labels_hjust = 0.5,   labels_vjust = 0.5,   labels_fontface = "plain",   labels_lineheight = 1.2,   tick_lwd = 1,   ... )

title: Create donut plot using Cartesian coordinates system — geom_donut
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes() aes_(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data displayed layer show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . init_angle Starting angle x0 Init position x y0 Init position y r1 Outer circle radius r2 Inner circle radius, inferior  r1 value. r1 r2 values swapped otherwise. color Plot border colour alpha Filling colour transparency [0,1] linewidth Plot border size spotlight_max TRUE want max value category drive positions categories spotlight_cat value inside categories vector. provided, category position drives positions categories spotlight_position used position category spotlighted. Value c("top","right", "bottom", "left"). valid spotlight_cat provided  spotlight_max set TRUE, default spotlight_position value set TRUE labels_with_tick TRUE want tick labelling categories labels_family Labels font family labels_size Labels font size labels_col Labels colour labels_hjust Labels horizontal adjusting labels_vjust Labels vertical adjusting labels_fontface Labels font face labels_lineheight Labels line height tick_lwd Ticks Size ... arguments passed layer().

title: Create donut plot using Cartesian coordinates system — geom_donut
text: ggplot2 layer.

title: Create donut plot using Cartesian coordinates system — geom_donut
code: my_df <- data.frame(cat = c("Apple", "Banana", "Pineapple"), val = c(2.65, 4.5, 6.25)) my_df |>   ggplot2::ggplot() +   geom_donut(ggplot2::aes(cat = cat, val = val)) +   ggplot2::coord_equal()

what: Create a series of circles plot — geom_series_circles
title: Create a series of circles plot — geom_series_circles
text: geom_series_circles() can used alternative single multiple bar charts. consists using whole fragments circles represent numerical values. draws circles, geom use ggplot2::coord_equal() maintain "aspect ratio". two arguments absolutely needed aes() mappings: x vector mapping abscissa  axis x,  .e. character vector x numerical vector,  numerical vector y character vector. y vector mapping ordinate axis y, .e. numerical vector x character vector vice versa. default mapping fill  value black fill  circles/fragments circles . can used  aes mapping  global argument circles.

title: Create a series of circles plot — geom_series_circles
code: geom_series_circles(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   show.legend = NA,   na.rm = FALSE,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   init_angle = 0,   r = 0.5,   color = NA,   linewidth = 0.5,   ... )

title: Create a series of circles plot — geom_series_circles
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes() aes_(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data displayed layer show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . init_angle Circle drawing starting angle. r Circle radius, <= 0.5. color Color circles/fragments circles borders. linewidth Size circles/fragments circles borders. ... arguments passed layer().

title: Create a series of circles plot — geom_series_circles
text: ggplot2 layer.

what: Create series of circles labels text — GeomSeriesText
title: Create series of circles labels text — GeomSeriesText
text: geom_series_text designed used concert geom_series_circles. renders label mapping final position series circles sequence. three arguments absolutely needed aes() mappings: x vector mapping abscissa  axis x,  .e. character vector x numerical vector,  numerical vector y character vector. y vector mapping ordinate axis y, .e. numerical vector x character vector vice versa. label Labels.

title: Create series of circles labels text — GeomSeriesText
code: GeomSeriesText  geom_series_text(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   position = "identity",   show.legend = NA,   na.rm = FALSE,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   ... )

title: Create series of circles labels text — GeomSeriesText
text: object class GeomSeriesText (inherits GeomText, Geom, ggproto, gg) length 1.

title: Create series of circles labels text — GeomSeriesText
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). position Position adjustment, either string, result call position adjustment function. jointly specified nudge_x nudge_y. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders(). ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat.

title: Create series of circles labels text — GeomSeriesText
text: ggplot2 layer.

title: Create series of circles labels text — GeomSeriesText
code: my_df <- data.frame(cat = c("Apple", "Banana", "Pineapple"), val = c(2.65, 4.5, 6.25)) my_df |>   ggplot2::ggplot() +   geom_series_circles(ggplot2::aes(cat, val)) +   geom_series_text(ggplot2::aes(cat, val, label = cat)) +   ggplot2::coord_equal()

title: See ggplot2::stat_identity — stat_series_text
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). geom geometric object use display data, either ggproto Geom subclass string naming geom stripped geom_ prefix (e.g. "point" rather "geom_point") position Position adjustment, either string, result call position adjustment function. jointly specified nudge_x nudge_y. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders(). ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat.
